content: turn 14 12sc slip_stitch slip_stitch turn 15 13sc slip_stitch slip_stitch turn 16 14sc slip_stitch slip_stitch turn 17 fo and cut yarn note if your single_crochet count doesn t line up directly to the pattern that is okay as long as you are putting 2 slip stitches in each row and referring back to the note above about where to stop your connection row your top will turn out correctly back strap making the side make a slipknot and put it on your hook then insert your yarn into the corner of the cup up at the frills chain 1 turn row 1 half_double_crochet in next 7 st chain 1 turn note you can use as many half_double_crochet as you want but the more you add the larger the side piece of the back strap will get 2 decrease by skip 1st st half_double_crochet in next 6 st chain 1 turn 3-7 5 row continue bracketed pattern until there is 2 sts left continue skipping first st half_double_crochet in each st till end chain 1 turn note if you have a larger bust size d - f cup i would suggest doing the bracketed pattern until there is 3 remaining stitches back strap making the back tie strap half_double_crochet in next st chain 1 turn repeat until the strap is as long as you d like it to be fo and cut yarn repeat above instructions to finish with 2 straps note if you have a larger bust size d - f cup i would recommend doing 2 half_double_crochet and then chaining 1 as this will make the strap thicker which will give more support top strap insert the yarn right next to the first scallop on right hand side with shells facing to front top strap row 1 single_crochet single_crochet 3sc same st single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch 2 single_crochet in next 3 sts on third one chain as long as you want i did 110 chains if you have a larger bust i would recommend doing more than me 3 single_crochet in each chain until the end connect the chain to the base with a single_crochet refer to pitcure and then single_crochet once more all in the same stitch 4 single_crochet in next 2 sts and repeat the same pattern single_crochet single_crochet 3sc same st single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch until you get to the middle note before every fpdc should be a slip_stitch and the 3sc should be at the top of the scallops if this isn t the case don t worry just alter the pattern to accompany your needs and it shouldn t have a major effect you can also alter it to be single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet 3sc single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch top strap row 5 add 3 slip_stitch in the middle space where we joined the 2 cups together and then continue the pattern above making sure to stop just before the 3 single_crochet in same stitch to chain and make the strap in the middle of the second scallop
